member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of events that can be queued at any time on the session.
member.value: Maximum number of events that can be queued at any time on the session. The default value is 50.
member.remarks: Any events that occur after the queue is full are discarded. You cannot set this property if an event is enabled.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.Session.TimeoutMilliseconds
member.summary: The I/O timeout in milliseconds for I/O communication on this resource session.
member.value: Minimum timeout value to use when accessing the device associated with the session. If the timeout is (0), operations will never wait for the device to respond. If the timeout is (1), I/O communication will not timeout. The default value is 2000 milliseconds.

member.value: NI-VISA driver session handle.
member.remarks: This property is provided only for extensibility. Use this property only if the desired VISA functionality is not a part of this API. If a future revision of this API adds the unavailable functionality, change statements that use this property to use the new API members.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Visa.GpibInterface.#ctor(System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object from the specified resource name, access modes, initialization timeout value, and resource name validation flag.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed.
The maximum time in milliseconds that this method waits to open a VISA session with the specified resource. This parameter does not set the property of the initialized instance.

If set to , the constructor ensures that the resource string represents a GPIB INTFC resource and throws a if the resource string represents an incorrect resource. If set to , the resource string can be any valid VISA resource.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.RegisterBasedSession.AllowDma
member.summary: Specifies whether direct memory access is enabled. In some cases you may not be able to change whether DMA is enabled, so reading this property value may not return the same value that was set.
member.value: if DMA is enabled. The initial value for this property is determined at run time.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.RegisterBasedSession.DestinationIncrement
member.summary: For MoveOut methods, specifies whether to do a block move or a FIFO write.
member.value: Number of elements the destination offset is incremented after every transfer. This value can be 0 or 1. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: Because the default value of this property is 1, the destination address is incremented after each transfer, and the MoveOut methods write into consecutive elements. If you set this property to 0, the MoveOut methods always write to the same element, essentially treating the destination as a FIFO register.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.RegisterBasedSession.SourceIncrement
member.summary: For MoveIn methods, specifies whether to do a block move or a FIFO read.
member.value: Number of elements the source offset is incremented after every transfer. This value can be 0 or 1. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: Because the default value of this property is 1, the source address is incremented after each transfer, and the MoveIn methods read from consecutive elements. If you set this property to 0, the MoveIn methods always read from the same element, essentially treating the source as a FIFO register.

member.value: Type of flow control the transfer mechanism uses. For a list of possible values, refer to . The default value is .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.Parity
member.summary: Gets or sets the parity used with every frame transmitted and received.
member.value: The parity used with every frame. For a list of possible values, refer to . The default value is .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.ReadTermination
member.summary: Gets or sets the method that terminates read operations.
member.value: The method that terminates read operations. For a list of possible values, refer to . The default value is .
member.remarks: The property only has an effect when the property is set to a value other than .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.ReplacementCharacter
member.summary: Gets or sets the character that replaces incoming characters that arrive with errors, such as a parity error.
member.value: The replacement character. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.RequestToSendState
member.summary: Gets or sets the state of the Request To Send (RTS) output signal.
member.value: The current state of the RTS output signal. For a list of possible values, refer to . The initial value is . However, when is set to , the property is read-only and returns .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.RingIndicatorState
member.summary: Gets the current state of the Ring Indicator (RI) input signal.
member.value: The current state of the RI input signal. For a list of possible values, refer to .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.StopBits
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of stop bits that indicate the end of a frame.
member.value: The number of stop bits that indicate the end of a frame. For a list of possible values, refer to . The default value is .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.WriteTermination
member.summary: Gets or sets the method that terminates write operations.
member.value: The method that terminates write operations. For a list of possible values, refer to .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.XOffCharacter
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the XOFF character used for XON/XOFF flow control (both input and output).
member.value: The value of the XOFF character. The default value is Control-S (0x13).
member.remarks: If the transfer mechanism is not using XON/XOFF flow control (software handshaking), the value of this property is ignored.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.XOnCharacter
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the XON character used for XON/XOFF flow control (both input and output).
member.value: The value of the XON character. The default value is Control-Q (0x11).
member.remarks: If the transfer mechanism is not using XON/XOFF flow control (software handshaking), the value of this property is ignored.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.AllowTransmit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow data transmission.
member.value: Suspends transmission when set to ; Resumes transmission when set to . The default value is .
member.remarks: If you are not using XON/XOFF flow control (software handshaking), it is invalid to set this attribute to .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.BreakLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration of the break signal asserted when is set to .
member.value: The duration in milliseconds of the break signal. Valid values include 1-500. The default value is 250 milliseconds.
member.remarks: If you want to control the assertion state and length of a break signal manually, use the property instead.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.BreakState
member.summary: Gets or sets the state of the break line.
member.value: The state of the break line. Refer to for a list of possible values. The default value is .
member.remarks: If is set to , suspends character transmission and places the transmission line in a break state until is reset to . With , you manually control the assertion state and length of a break signal. If you want VISA to send a break signal after each write operation automatically, use the and properties instead.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.Connected
member.summary: Indicates whether the port is properly connected to another port or device.
member.remarks: This property is valid only with serial drivers developed by National Instruments and documented to support this feature with the corresponding National Instruments hardware.
member.value: if the port is properly connected to another port or device.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.DiscardNull
member.summary: Gets or sets if NUL characters that are received during read operations are discarded.
member.value: if NUL characters must be discarded. The default value is . Set this to for binary transfers.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.WireMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the transceiver mode of the interface.
member.remarks: For RS-485 hardware, this property is valid only with the RS-485 serial driver developed by National Instruments. For RS-232 hardware, the values and are valid only with RS-232 serial drivers developed by National Instruments and documented to support this feature with the corresponding National Instruments hardware. When this feature is not supported, is the only valid value.
member.value: The transceiver mode of the interface. The initial value for this property is determined at run time.

member.name: E:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.Break
member.summary: Occurs when a break signal is received.

member.name: E:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.ClearToSend
member.summary: Occurs when the Clear To Send (CTS) line changes state.
member.remarks: If the CTS line changes state quickly several times in succession, you might not receive an event notification for each change.

member.name: E:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.DataSetReady
member.summary: Occurs when the Data Set Ready (DSR) line changes state.
member.remarks: If the DSR line changes state quickly several times in succession, you might not receive an event notification for each change.

member.name: E:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.DataCarrierDetect
member.summary: Occurs when the Data Carrier Detect (DCD) line changed state.
member.remarks: If the DCD line changes state quickly several times in succession, you might not receive an event notification for each change.

member.name: E:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.RingIndicator
member.summary: Occurs when the Ring Indicator (RI) input signal is asserted.

member.name: E:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.AnyCharacterReceived
member.summary: Occurs when at least one data byte is received.
member.remarks: If multiple data bytes arrive at once, you might receive only one event. After receiving this event, query the serial port for the number of bytes available via the attribute.

member.name: E:NationalInstruments.Visa.SerialSession.TerminationCharacterReceived
member.summary: Occurs when the termination character is received.
member.remarks: The actual termination character is specified by setting prior to enabling this event.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Visa.UsbTerminationMethod
member.summary: Specifies the available methods to terminate a read operation on the object.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Visa.UsbTerminationMethod.None
member.summary: The read operation ignores short packets. Reads do not terminate until all of the requested data is received, or an error occurs.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Visa.UsbTerminationMethod.Short
member.summary: The read operation terminates on a short packet. Use this setting if the device terminates all read transfers with a short packet, including sending a zero (short) packet when the last data packet is full.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Visa.UsbTerminationMethod.ShortOrCount
member.summary: The read operation terminates on a short packet or when it receives the requested count of data bytes. Use this setting if the device does not send zero packets.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.VxiSession.AllowDma

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.VxiSession.DestinationIncrement
member.summary: For MoveOut methods, specifies whether to do a block move or a FIFO write.
member.value: Number of elements the destination offset is incremented after every transfer. This value can be 0 or 1. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: Because the default value of this property is 1, the destination address is incremented after each transfer, and the MoveOut methods write into consecutive elements. If you set this property to 0, the MoveOut methods always write to the same element, essentially treating the destination as a FIFO register.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Visa.VxiSession.SourceIncrement
member.summary: For MoveIn methods, specifies whether to do a block move or a FIFO read.
member.value: Number of elements the source offset is incremented after every transfer. This value can be 0 or 1. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: Because the default value of this property is 1, the source address is incremented after each transfer, and the MoveIn methods read from consecutive elements. If you set this property to 0, the MoveIn methods always read from the same element, essentially treating the source as a FIFO register.
